Reason: Hot flashes radiation dried up my o
Comments: Use your hair dryer after you apply the patch  turn it on the patch for a few seconds and it will make the patch adhere

Side Effects: mild headache_ fatigue_ weight gain/bloating in mid-section_ breast soreness_ bleeding
Comments: I started menopause in my mid-30s and am taking this primarily because it is said to improve bone density_ and I was deathly afraid of fosamax.  Since yesterday I've been experiencing more than breakthrough bleeding. I'm not sure if I should be concerned about this. I'm not thrilled about the weight gain_ and am concerned about reading all of the comments about hair loss.

Side Effects: Hair thinning loss_ heart palpitations_ extreme vaginal wetness.
Comments: It was great for my hot flashes & mood swings!  I had problems  with the patch irrating my skin.

Side Effects: Sadly @ this age there can be SO many issues. I have some food intolerances_ makes me flush. I also think it's really questionable as to the reliability of the dispensing of a patch_  especially when you consider what we're doing to try to make them work...Thought I had the WORST hot flashes; not so. Flushing from allergies.   SPOTTING! Weight gain? or inability to lose weight? some skin issues_ thinning hair_ hard to say if that's from the patch_ occasional headaches_  hard to put that on the patch.  Overall anything is better than suffering extreme hot flashes_ which I'm starting to think are from a myriad of other things along with menopause . To experience the feeling that you're going to spontaneously combust!!  It's hard to believe that other women went through this in the 20s & the 30s .  Of course_ conveniently we get to blame big Pharma for everything . Ideally what it would be great to know about is how some women function who have NEVER HAD THEIR hormones FUSSED with ! Starting at the ages of 13 14 15 and 16.  And now we have the morning after pill_ and another IUD!!! These companies are just looking for trouble aren't they ?  So when you have stats that I can use to compare what it's like to be a woman who hasn't had her body completely contorted by the time she's 25 then I guess I'll know exactly what the real side effects are !
Comments: The patch doesn't stay on! NONE of the patches stay on!  The ONLY way to get the patch to stay on; get yourself what is known as a sterile clear window bandage_ take the patch apart put it in the center of the window_ then put the bandage on with the patch . Only the manufacturers will know if this is changing the effects of the distribution of the patch. Maybe they should look at the window bandages and figure out how to incorporate a patch into it (duh) because the damn patches are expensive! Having them come off  is pretty much enough to stop using them_ when you consider the cost of the bandages and the patch .  I guess we women are always supposed to spend more money_ suffer a little more_ get a little less out of life! we can thank the manufacture for this one this time COME ON FIX THE STUPID APPLICATION!'

Side Effects: WEIGHT GAIN_ my hair has been changing (ticking me off!) Didn't think I was loosing it but I'll pay more attention now after reading all the reviews. Spotting. Recently I seem to be having "break through" bleeding. (Frequently!) Slight headache.
Comments: It took about 3 weeks for me to get relief from those damn hot flashes and night sweats_ but when the patch finally kicked in all the menopause symptoms stopped. My biggest issue is the patch peeling up around the edges. This happens not too long after I put it on. I clean the area first with alcohol and dry it completely (with my blowdryer!) This is my biggest complaint. Maybe if it were made of a more Band Aid like material it would stay on better. Its like putting a hard piece of contact paper on your skin without getting bubbles! I've already had more of an issue with the weather getting warmer and my skin getting sweaty. It peels right up around the edges.

Side Effects: Initially headaches and very swollen tender breasts. Stopped patch to allow  breasts to settle down.  hot flashes returned with a vengeance two months later_ so started patch back    Cured hot flashes_ have some ups and downs with mood_ maybe patches are not quite all the same dose?
Comments: I use a waterproof band aid to cover my patch_ sort of like the ones that go over IV's in the hospital. Works like a charm. No leaking of water on patch and it stays on for the whole 3 days.  for those with weight gain_ I was gaining weight through the middle without the patch_ age related_ menopause symptoms I believe_ so I dont think the patch makes that worse.  Just have to eat less sugar_ and exercise to curb that.

Side Effects: None so far
Comments: I started going through menopause in my late thirties_ recently went on osteoporosis medication and doctor thought combo would work better. After 15 years still suffering from hot flashes and some hair loss and thought hrt may be beneficial for these symptoms also. But now think it may make hair loss worse.

Side Effects: Not sure but doctor is requiring me to stop said the risks outweigh the benefits at my age and I'm back to having hot flashes and I'm not a happy girl

Went on it a few months back wore it for about 6 weeks started with heavy bleeding went off for 2 months still bad anxiety went back on for 8 days started with weakness and dizziness so took it off again just don't like it.
Breast cancer!!!!!

Initially_ I thought I was going to have a heart attack. I had heart palpitations_ I had a sharp pain in my arm. I immediately took it off. Later_ I cut it in half and for about 6 months was fine. Over the last year_ I noticed I have lost about 1/3 of the thickness of my hair and have thickness around my tummy_ hips and upper thighs (back area). I am going to go off of it and see what happens.
Gained weight in midsection_ hair loss_ extreme bloating in belly_ felt as if it deadened my emotions and caused me to feel as if everything was in a fog.
Comments: I suffered from more than 50 hot flashes every 24 hours_ and I was totally miserable. It completely cured all of my menopausal symptoms almost immediately.

Side Effects: Bloat_ Hair loss_ mild rash at site(not troubling)_ weight gain in middle_ increased migraines_ Acne (mild)_ mild bleeding (also not that troubling)_ tiredness.
Comments: Given the side effects I mention_ I live in fear of running out of these. They are a lifesaver for surgical menopause mood swings_ edginess_ lack of focus_ lack of sleep_ sweats!!

Side Effects: Can't provide true feedback at this time_ just started but hopeful.  Also_a little confused because patch is coming off after a few hours. Suppose to last 3-4 days.

Reason: Constant hot flashes_ day and night
Comments: I've been taking Combipatch for a year now and I can honestly say it's given me back my life!  I was suffering from constant hot flashes day and night_ as well as weight gain and depression and Combipatch has helped so much!  I've lost 20 lbs. of the 40 lbs. I gained prior to going on the patch and hopefully will continue to lose.  I've had no unpleasant side effects thus far.

Side Effects: Just finished two weeks sample. Started bleeding on day 9-15
Comments: Began patch b/c I gained 6 lbs_ mostly in my middle after being the same weight for 25 years! Also_ my hair was thinning beyond belief. Also_ have 3:30AM wake up calls with night sweats. After patch_ night sweats and interrupted sleep are gone!! Weight still there and hair seems the same but not worse. It will take a while to see if I lose weight and regrow lost hair. Since the weight and hair loss started before combi patch_ I don't directly attribute it to patch. Don't like the bleeding tho. Will continue for another month or so and re evaluate.

Side Effects: wet vag. increased sex drive_ 15 pounds in only 10 months. weight gain in mid section. Now I feel so unattractive_ fat and old. Who cares about sex at this pointpoint. My clothes no longer fit. I dont have money for new clothes. I do not have a boyfriend anyway_ so sex and I diskeded
Comments: I just took the patch off yesterday. Before I looked great_ before this patch with no boyfriend_m Now I can't fit in my clothes.No boyfriend still but I feel so ugly old And fat DO NOT USE THIS PATCH it makes life worse

Side Effects: Face breakout is all
Comments: This has been a huge answer to prayer...after 3 years of seeking help...cardiologist_ primary and endrocronologist it was hormones! My symptoms were apparently unusual

Side Effects: Side effects??? I would have welcomed them!   the patch was coming off within 2 hours! And my skin is as dry as a popcorn fart.
Comments: Why not just make them like the tagederm Patches those usually seal Sri tight and stay on. If you can get them in!

Side Effects: increased anxiety_ hair loss_ acne_ insomnia_ pms type feelings all month long
Comments: The progestin in this (norethindrone acetate) is very androgenic. For me_ this patch increased my anxiety_ gave me acne (which I never have)_ made me very sleepy but too anxious to sleep. I am very progestin/progesterone intolerant. I went back to vivelle-dot (estrogen only patch) and felt better within a few days. Calmer and focused and able to sleep normally.

Side Effects: Significant hair thinning. Weight gain in abdomen_ hip_ + thighs.
Comments: The patch improved my sex life significantly. I just had tummy tuck_ and have been working out to improve my health. My hair is becoming so thin_ I am thinking of wearing a wig. The patch did improve vaginal dryness. I would rather use lubricants during sex with my husband_ than have to resort to wearing a wig.

Side Effects: The first couple months I spotted lightly a few times but then that was it_ it went away. I do have a red mark when I change patches but that goes away after a day or so_ NO site itching as others complained about.
Comments: The Combipatch has made a huge difference in my overall well-being. Prior to the patch I would cry a lot for no reason_ felt exhausted_ suffered with major night sweats_ had wrinkly skin and a loss of muscle tone.  All have improved greatly. I took myself off the patch after about 1 yr because I was feeling so good I didn't think I needed it.  Well_ into my second month of being off the patch the depression_ exhaustion_ extreme anxiety_ night sweats all returned.  Needless to say_ I went back on the patch and I am once again feeling GREAT!  It's so good to feel happy_ energetic and just feel like me again!  I feel sorry for those ladies who can't get this kind of relief.

Reason: For hot flashes And mood swings.
Side Effects: I developed a blood clot (DVT) in my right leg and my left arm. Thank God it was caught in time before any serious health issues.
Comments: This product is good but caused a blood clot for me and my sister.

Side Effects: occasional spotting the first 6 months then it stopped..  No other side effects.  I feel GREAT!
Comments: This has been a miracle for me.  I tried other hormone therapy and even the supposed generic equivalent from Teva and everything else was awful.  I use 50mcg/140mcg so low dose progesterone.  Also_ I take 10mg DHEA based on pcdb clinical trial.

Side Effects: The first 6 weeks on combo patch there were no noticeable side effects but then heavy spotting for 6 weeks - at around 12 weeks the bleeding stopped.  Mild breakouts during the time I was spotting. Gained 11 pounds or 10% of my body weight in the 5 months on the patch - this was NOT caused by menopause_ I have  always been underweight.  Breasts became very tender and swollen.  Itching and redness at application site from adhesive.  Loss of energy - not certain if this was a result of HRT or just the long winter.
Comments: I'm fortunate that the weight gain was not unhealthy_ in and of itself_ as I was so thin to begin with but 10% in 5 months is huge.  I quit HRT as the rate of weight gain wasn't slowing and my breasts became huge.  This was concerning - what else was HRT doing to my body that wasn't obvious?

Side Effects: Some bleeding. Your review space is to limited I was on the patch  for 31 years  not 10 months radiation made me go into menopause.
Comments: Been on patch for. 31 years have no history of breast cancer_ stopped my hot flashes bad moods made life full  again .

Side Effects: The first two months I had no side effects.  It gave me my life back. I had not had a period in seven months and now I have a period every 10-12 days.
Comments: It did cause weight gain_ mainly in my mid section. Before the patch I went to every doctor with complaints of heart palpitations_ dizziness_ fatigue_ mood swings_ severe hot flashes and night sweats. Finally_ my OB/GYN knew the problem! Menopause. At the beginning_ I thought this patch was the greatest thing ever created. The ongoing breakthrough bleeding is not fun_ but I'll have to weigh out what is worse. I did try higher dose patch_ but did not stop to spotting. Of course_ my doctor wants to perform and Endometrial biopsy. Don't know what to do?  Come off patch and have debilitating symptoms or deal with having bleeding every 10 days.

Side Effects: leaves mark (sometimes  a scab) where former patch was. Hair loss!!!
Comments: The Combipatch eliminated my night sweats and hot flashes as well as the vaginal dryness. I am just talking a break after noticing my hair thinning. Now my hair comes out in clumps when I comb/brush it! I see this is a common side effect after reading reviews. I also noticed some changes in my skin (more bumps/cellulite?) and fat/weight gain around my middle but it's hard to say if it's due to the patch or simply menopause. Bummed cuz my OBGYN just returned from a menopause seminar and said this was the talk of the town!

Side Effects: bleeding
Comments: This has been a god send for hot flashes! And vaginal dryness! I am not happy about the bleeding though...just a little spotting at first but today it was heavier than that!   I also have hair loss_ but I had it before starting on the combipatch so I think it must be from something else.

Side Effects: My energy level increased.  Moods were better.  Hot flashes went away but I still had some hot spells.  My problem was that after a few months I cramped and hurt.   Also started having too heavy of a discharge.   I cut the patch in half and that worked a little better for a short  time then I had the same thing.   I did go to the dr to make sure I had nothing else going on.  All test results were negative.  Only thing it cld be is the patch.  Going to get off of it as the dr suggested and see if things clear up.  If so then I know for sure it was the patch.
none
Comments: I was on them too long. Dr. took me off of them but I need them back as I have severe hot flashes still at the age of 64

Side Effects: Weight gain_ itchy dry skin_ occasional headaches

Bleeding the 1st year - now terrible itching at patch site and under breast - talking to DR next month at annual exam to see if there is something else  - quit taking for a month and the hot flashes and night sweats were back full force - when does this end? I have been gong through this for 10 yrs now - is this something I have to live with the rest of my life? What a cruel punishment for being a women... And my hair us very very thin now....

Reason: For cravings! I have lost 14 lbs!
Side Effects: They come loose easily

Reason: to alleviate hot flashes and fatigu
Side Effects: regular bleeding_ belly bloatiness_ hip and thigh weight gain.
Comments: I thought it was great in beginning because it immediately rid me of severe hot flashes. However_ I can't take the regular bleeding and weight gain.  I already had metabolic issues when menopause began.  I am very glad I found this site_ because I was concerned about the bleeding and possible cancer. After reading other comments_ I decided today is my last day for the patch and  I  will pray for something better to replace the patch.  I dread the idea of returning hot flashes_ but I cancer and bleeding is worse.

Side Effects: Some swelling in hands & feet_ mild acne_ & weight gain. Hot flashes are completely gone!

First day on the patch. First thing I noticed_ is within about two hours I felt more clear mentally than I have for months...not sure if related_ but would make sense. About 5 hours into it_ I started feeling chest discomfort...still feeling it...and a little queasy. Now_ 12 hours into it today_ feeling tired at only 4 pm...

Some neck and jaw tension. Sore throat. I must say reading all these hair loss comments are scaling me. I have noticed my skin on my face comes off  when putting makeup on. (Nothing servere) a yeast seems to be coming on but I had one before this patch. About two weeks before. I am high risk breast cancer. Also have iud put in a year ago for heavy ongoing bleeding. My doctor says I am on the lowest dose and will only be on until my moods are better. I don't think I will feel comfortable on this for more than one month. Unless I am super happy. It's really to soon to rate but I had to. It was mostly forgetfulness and lack of focus is my reasons for trying this to see if it helped.

Nurse practioner prescribed it after a brief discussion of my menopausal symptoms.  It sounded great.  I told her my mother had breast cancer and she said I was very healthy and as long as I kept up with check up and mammograms I would be fine as I was in good health.  Long story short out of the clear blue while on the patch I have developed inflammatory breast cancer IBC and have 4 tumors in the same breast and had 10 lymph nodes removed.  I had to go to Dana Farber as there is no cure for IBC and they are studying it.  Every year I would ask are you sure this is safe for me of course the reply was yes.  In doing further research my cancer is estrogen positive so the patch fed the cancer and made it highly invasive.  There is no cure to date.  I have had chemo_ masdectomy and radiation.  The nurse did not write any of my family history on my chart as I got my records.  I also had a fibroid tumor benign removed while using the patch and it is indicated that they should be removed 4-6

I started out taking the .05mg/.14mg/day patch in Sept. 2012.  The lower dose helped greatly with my vaginal dryness_ insomnia_ hot flashes_ mood swings_ & fatigue_ but it was causing continuous breakthrough bleeding_ so in Dec.2012 my doctor changed me to the higher dose of progesterin of 05/.25mg which corrected the breakthrough bleeding but now (2 months into the higher dose) I am having breakouts of acne all over my face.  I am going to try an acne medication (probably ProActiv) and see if that helps before I give up on the patch altogether. The patch is easy to use but it does leave a sticky residue when you peel it off.  Also_ it helps to rub the area you're going to apply it to with alcohol so that it will stick to your skin better.  This is my first time using HRT.
severe headpain and aching legs
Comments: worked very nice on low dose_ but kept bleeding so he gave me the higher dose_ oh what a mistake thought I was going to have a stroke. going off a few days than maybe go to the low dose again.

Side Effects: Hair Loss!  Shedding became so bad I had to stop using this drug.  I have not used this patch for one month and there is a remarkable improvement.  This should be noted in the package insert.  I have seen many complaints about the same side effect.  If you are experiencing hair loss - stop this drug.  It gets worse with time.
Comments: Add hair loss/shedding to side effects and package insert.

Side Effects: Extreme breast tenderness - abated after cutting the patch in half.  Hair loss - a lot.  Feeling way too tired.  Terrible acne - never had it before.
Comments: I'm off it permanently.  It's dreadful.

Side Effects: VERY SCARY. The very first time I tried it_ this is what happened. I put the patch on and 20 minutes later I had severe chest pain_ sharp shooting pain_ but also like a load of bricks was on my chest and neck. It was getting more intense_ a hot feeling too_ so I took that patch off. After a half hour the symptoms started to subside. Very scary. Obviously_ I don't handle the hormones too well. I'll stick with what I've been doing... swimming_ walking_ meditating. I NEVER want to feel that way again.

Severe itching and red welts at patch sites developed after a few months of use.  Using hydrocortisone and neosporin to treat sites moving the new patches an inch or so to the right or left trying to give skin sites a chance to heal.  Also have hip and back pain now which I had not had prior to starting patch.  Mild acne and weight gain.
Comments: Sweats and insomnia symptoms significantly better.  Have occasional spotting still.

Side Effects: I was taking Climara Patch for a year but bleed too much. I switched to The Combi patch. I' spot occasionally but nothing like before. Although_I had a tummy tuck last September_ I do see abdominal bloating. In addition; the kicker is I'm tired more than usual. I'm an energetic person and always have been. The patch is slowing me down_ that is my biggest concern. I'm sane again_ thank God but too tired. I plan to see my Gyn soon. My mother also died of breast cancer at the ripe age of 61. I can only ask God to cover me! The menopausal symptoms can make an individual really loose it.
ended up having surgery. Biopsy.  Caused endometrial hyperplasia.  Screened and biopsied for cancer of the uterus.  Doctor explained this is a bad drug
Comments: it only helped with night sweats_ had red welts on my stomach

Side Effects: legs and hands swells real bad havent bleed in 5 months now started and dark brown almost black period  bad stomach pain all the time very sore still have mood swings not as bad can not think good weight gain but i'm staying swelled all the time and getting hair above my lip and under my chin whats up with that
Comments: I do not like what it does to me want off too many side effects

Side Effects: The hot flashes are gone (but they were not severe) and I am sleeping better_ BUT I have been bleeding (except for a few days off here and there) since Dec.1st and it now Feb. 17th. It is reeking havoc with my romantic life. I'm calling my doctor tomorrow so I can set up an appt. I want off of this! There has to be something else I can do for the mood swings! (Which is the reason he put me on the patch in the first place).
bloating and back pain (although I don't know if this is because of the patch) could be other factors but I didn't have this when I was not on the patch
Comments: I am using it for post surgery (hysterectomy) menopause. It stopped the hot flashes_ helped with insomnia_ and better focus_ energy and libido.  But now I have bloating and back pain (like right before a period).

Side Effects: Itchy patch site_ periods I was not expecting_ weight gain_ extreme thirst_ face break outs
Comments: Hot flashes are GONE! But after 3 years of no period suddenly having one is yucko. Itchy at patch site. I use this med every 7 days. Face breaking out like a teen. Sleepy at 2pm even though I take B-12 shots once a month. Used Prempro before from other Gyno. Loved it. New Doctor said no. I dislike bleeding again and don't know if I'll stay on this med. Wonder how it works during the high heat of Summer.

Side Effects: Update to my previous review: Some dark bleeding_ breast tenderness_ otherwise still very happy and feeling much better than w/o it.  I will be 51 in a few days. I am kind of worried about using HRT at my age but my doctor felt it necessary as osteoporosis runs heavily in my family and I have it already.
Comments: Someone tried to email me w/questions but I accidentally deleted it and can't seem to recover it! Resend and I'll try to answer your questions!My hot flashes and night sweats were severe and I was always so uncomfortably hot but it's 98% better now.

Side Effects: Initially_ normal period like bleeding_ which became more frequent to almost daily. A constant mild headache_ weight gain_ breast tenderness. I like a lot about the patch but ultimately discontinued it because of constant bleeding and headache.
Hair loss_ itching at site of patch.
Comments: Initially worked very well for hot flashes. I went from 19/day to zero. After about 4 months I started noticing an unusual amount of hair loss_ my hair is definitely thinner. Stopped taking 3 wks ago_ hot flashes back_ not as frequent_ still seem to be losing a lot of hair.

Side Effects: Horrible breast tenderness_ bleeding all the time_ bad cramps. Was on Femhrt prior but they stopped making it. Dr. put me on this patch after I had taken  nothing for 3 weeks and hot flashes had returned. Did not bleed at all on Femhrt. Now bleeding all the time and my breast hurt all the time. Today is last day on this patch. Starting a new pill tomorrow.
After first year the patch site started itching and producing a red spot. I reported to Novartis & Dr.  No one has any suggestions thus far.  Adhesive problem. INCREDIBLY annoying.
Comments: Patch is highly effective. Dr. said can only use for 5 yrs. No side effect except intense red itchy spots that take a while to heal after i remove patch. Sometimes i can't stand it and move patch to another area after 1 day.

Side Effects: Serious HAIR LOSS: 1. Several major sheds. 2. Ongoing daily hair loss. 3. Noticeable thinning of hair and widening part.**** I have stopped the patch and within 8-10 days the daily hair shed has noticeably tapered off*****
Comments: I posted on 04/28/2012 re: Hairloss. I thought I would wait a few months to see if the hair shed would slow down. So it has been one year since the shed began: July 2011 to August 2012.Since my April post I have found the following information posted by a medical doctor/hormone specialist on an HRT forum - Baldtruthtalk.com:"Combipatch has a progestin in it that has slight testosterone-like activity" So I would take this to mean if the patient has Androgen sensitivity /DHT sensitivity the progestin in this particular patch may trigger their hair loss. This side effect is not disclosed in the literature included with Combi-Patch from NOVARTIS Pharmaceuticals. WHY IS THIS NOT INDICATED by Novartis??  ****"CAN CAUSE NOTICEABLE HAIR LOSS" ***** THIS ABSOLUTELY SHOULD BE DISCLOSED! I am stopping this patch now. I have had all the Thyroid and other panels and they are normal so the only possible cause for my thinning hair is the patch. '

Side Effects: Quite a bit of bleeding (sometimes dark_ almost black_ some odor) first three years_ then began wearing it on my back only (had been wearing on front only) and bleeding is much less and more like normal menstrual blood when it does occur. It now lasts only a few days per month if at all.
Comments: pros: increased muscle tone_ I am stronger than I've been in years (workout with kettlebells)_ better skin tone and hair.  cons: increased middle fat until I became mostly vegetarian_ cut out all refined foods.....eat only fresh veg and fruit_ some protein like tofu_ walnuts and almonds_ dairy.   It seemed like I had a little hair loss at first but now hair is shinier and thicker. Zero hot flashes_ less dryness_ a few pimples as I had when younger. This has been a miraculous drug for me_ but am beginning to have bad heartburn and wonder if patch is contributing_ and/or diet?? Or just the baby aspirin my gyne prescribed at the same time? So happy to see this website. And how interesting that the middle weight gain and hair loss experienced by so many are not listed in the adverse side effects of the so-called experts. On the other hand_ middle weight gain and hair loss are quite common for those in this age group who are not on HRT_ so we need more studies to sort it out.

Side Effects: Having severe itching at patch site. Some hair loss just recently. Mid section weight gain. Trouble making patch stick although following instructions. Otherwise pleased.

I'm not positive these come from the combi patch but I do know they happened after starting to take it. 1-Headaches. I get a dull headache if I don't change the patch as prescribed (1 every 3 1/2 days) 2-Constipation. Not terrible but noticed a change in my bowel movements for a short while. 3-Hair loss. Again_ not sure this is from the combi patch but after reading other comments I'm thinking it is.
Comments: I noticed that the hot flashes are much milder and the night sweats tolerable. Neither are extreme as before. I haven't noticed a weight gain per say but do work out and try to eat right. Although after reading comments THAT may be coming! Yikes! My biggest concern right now is the hair loss. The reason I came to this site was to "just see" if there was any connection between the combi patch and hair loss. The comments tell me there IS! I can't believe how much hair I've lost in the past few month. My daughter even said "Mom_ that's not normal" and I took pictures of it to show my doctor. I'm scheduled for a physical in a month and will discuss this with him. Darn...I may be wearing a wig soon!

Side Effects: HAIR LOSS!   Weight gain in waist and boost in breast size..
Comments: I wish I had found this board earlier. I started losing noticeable amounts of hair about six months into the wearing the patch. I thought it was because of the summer months or the fact that I used cleansing conditioners on my hair. But the loss is ongoing unless I stop wearing it for a few weeks.My hair is much thinner. I have to decide whether to have peaceful nights with no  hot flashes / sweats and fuller breasts OR keep from going bald..

Side Effects: Weight gainBloatingSome bleeding_tolerable though
Comments: Use high + low dose in conjunction_ only way the hot flashes would slow down. Had them so bad I looked like I just got out of the shower everytime one occured.

Side Effects: Started having bleeding due to thinning endometrium.  So_  discontinued in Dec. 2012.  Having hot flashes_ night sweats_ & great hair loss!   Help!

Started 2/5/12 after one week lapse in estrogen only_ on esttogenyou only for2 3 mos. This period of without hormones was a good test as MP symptoms returned.  Night sweats_ anxiety and skin crawling. On patch symptoms were rapid heart rate_ some irritability_ significant hair loss_ fat increase middle_ but gradually reduced heat_ skin crawling symtom. Cut patch in half_ doing better_ some sex drive returning. Talk to doc next Monday.
Still not sleeping_ always hot_ hair loss_ bloating in the middle area_ weight gain.

no side effects at all unless the joint pain I am having is from them. I don't think it is. I teach aerobics and have been teaching over 22 years. I will say that since taking the patch my bone density numbers have increased A LOT but I have also been better lately about taking by Calcium.
Comments: I have gotten more fat around my middle in last 2 years and I exercise very intensly 5 times per week...(minimum!)

Reason: Hot Flashes and Severe mood swings
Side Effects: My periods are back to normal. (I wasn't having regular periods prior to Combipatch for the last year) I like having periods_ it makes me feel young again.  I've also notice last month I felt the familiar pain of ovulating.  My Hot flashes have decreased significantly and just 1-2 days prior to my new patch due date_ they return In full force.  AND as well as my erratic mood swings.  Once I place a new one I feel great.  I haven't had any hair loss_ but my mid section has increased.
Comments: I will try it for a year and then ask my Doctor what she thinks when I go for my annual next June.

Side Effects: Vaginal bleeding every day. Developed a month or so into start of it and never stopped_ also developed an odor. Had to go off the patch_ but bleeding still continued for a while after stopping. Nothing wrong per MD. So?
Comments: Loved it because I could sleep well and moods were better_ but I couldn't take the bleeding every day anymore_ and the odor. Even though the bleeding was generally light_ it was EVERY DAY. Put on stomach weight also.

Side Effects: Starting to have hair loss_ almost in clumps.  Also_ weight gain (middle area)_ some bleeding but tolerable.
Comments: I started to apply 1/2 patch at a time in hopes that this would help and it has not.  It has helped night sweats_ and dryness tremendously but I'm afraid I can't live with the weight gain and hair loss.

Side Effects: Weight gain in my belly.  Feel bloated all the time.  Have also noticed hair loss
Comments: I feel more alert_ have more energy_ sleep better and the hot flashes are gone.  I'm having a real problem though_ with the belly & back fat that seems to come with using the patch.

Side Effects: Weight-gain in hips and legs.
Comments: I have been working out_ eating right for 11 years_ just to stay between 130-135_ 5'8"_ and now can feel and see I have gained in my hips and thighs_ the worse area I have been suffering anxiety with most of my life.  I constantly am looking in the mirror and can't believe that I again_ am one more time_ annoyed that I still have to watch what I eat just to "HOPE" that I can wear my jeans.  Honestly_ does it ever end.  Had the same problem with BC pills and used IUD in my 30's and 40's_ which definitely relieved the weight gain.  What more can I do??  I cannot go back to the way I felt_ but this is so frustrating.  Had the same problem with HRT oral meds_ and stopped_ but 3 years of non-hormone replenishment has put a toll on my well-being.

Side Effects: Hair loss_ face bloat_ weight gain
Comments: This product greatly relieved all menopause symptoms_ but made my irritable bowel syndrome worse.  Tried controlling side effects by cutting patches in half_ no help.  The other side effects were unpleasant but doable;  the worsened IBS was a deal breaker.

Side Effects: weight gain_ hair loss
Comments: works well for my needs. Just dont know if the weight gain is pre-menapause or not_ gained 10 lbs in a year_ hair loss may make me wean off eventually.

Side Effects: HAIR LOSS
Comments: After being on the patch about 6 weeks_ I noticed I was "shedding"_  It has gotten much worse_ my hair looks terrible.  Had my thyroid levels checked as I do take synthyroid...my levels were perfect.  This is the only thing I've done differently and I feel it is the patch...It has totally stopped the hot flashes and I am sleeping so it is a bummer that I am starting to wean myself off.  However_ I would rather have flashes than lose my hair...I just pray it will grow back!

Side Effects: Major hair loss.
Comments: It stopped my hot flashes but the hairs loss is really scary  My doctor is doing blood work to see if it is related to my thyroid.

Side Effects: I feel as though I have gained weight and just overall blubber_ since being on the patch.  Could be menopause too_ so who knows.  One thing that has been disheartening is the hair loss/thinning I have experienced over the past year.  My hair today is nothing it was 2 years ago. I have been to my Gynecologist & Dermatologist and they blame it on age.  I am searching to find out if any CombiPatch users have experienced hair loss or changes in their hair.  Otherwise the patch has been great and I haven't had a hot flash since being on it. I would prefer_ however_ to NOT be on it....someday_ I suppose.
Developed mean rash at application site after 6 months of use_ I'm wondering if the dry_ winter months have something to do with this. Spotty bleeding comes and goes.
Comments: I'm going to try hydrocortisone cream_ see if that works_ and then I'll see my Doctor if it doesn't.

Side Effects: slight rash at patch site; controlled with hydrocortisone cream after patch removal
Comments: It's saved my sanity--hot flashes and lack of sleep were completely debilitating.  Used the patch for 2 years_ gradually cutting it down (literally cutting it with a scissors) until I weaned myself off it.  Within two weeks the hot flashes were back as bad as ever.  Went back on it at 1/2 patch twice a week--still have very mild hot flashes mostly at night but it's a good compromise for me--hot flashes are largely controlled and my dose is low enough that I don't worry as much about the cancer risk (my mom died of breast cancer so I am high risk--but my quality of life was so wrteched with the hot flashes that I am willing to take the increased cancer risk).

Side Effects: Bleeding_ both spotting and period-like bleeding_ even after 1 year.
Comments: Previous HT (climara patch + prometrium pills): had no bleeding_ but depression and fatigue during progesterone cycle. Combipatch evens me out_ reduces body(nerve) pains_ increases sex drive and sleep hours. Bleeding is a problem_ had several days of bleeding 9 months of 12; may try climara pro patch next.

Side Effects: cramps_ breast tenderness_ yeast infection_ bleeding_ bloating_ stomach pain
Comments: Helped my mental symptoms of menopause but I stopped using the Combipatch because of intense bloating_ gas and abdominal pain.

Side Effects: None that I can attribute to combipatch...
Comments: I was hallucinating from lack of sleep after months of 24/7 severe hot flashes_ and went literally crying to my doctor to give me "real drugs"! Within 12 hours the hot flashes had COMPLETELY vanished and I called my Dr to tell him he was a genius. He claims this patch helps osteoporosis and he can tell women who are on the patch because they have less wrinkles. I probably shouldn't take it many more years_ but for now_ if I forget to change into a fresh one_ the hot flashes start back up_ so I obviously still need it.  Supposedly it's "bioidentical" and safer than the old bad hormone drugs.

Side Effects: I have been using this patch for over one year. In recent weeks_ I have had severe itching_ swelling_ and redness at patch site. It takes a good 2-weeks before I can apply patch to same area.
Comments: I will be seeing my gynecologist to discuss this matter!

Side Effects: Developed acne and unpredictable spotting.  I have stopped taking this because my face started breaking out.
Comments: Changing patch twice per week was convenient.  The patch stays on fine and isn't uncomfortable.  Does leave sticker residue on the skin_ however.

Side Effects: none
Comments: my bone scan improved from -2.4 to -.8_ I sleep well at night_ don't have mood swings_night sweats_ and never gained any weight. I'm 5ft. 5 1/2 in. and weigh 113 lbs.

Side Effects: vaginal bleeding
Comments: The hot flashes are gone and my sexual desire is back.

Side Effects: weignt gain. not sure if from combipatch or just menopause in general. pain in hips and legs but could be from a brief time I was taking Actonel_ and later_ Miacalcin for my osteoporosis.
Comments: started using primarily for hot flashes but found out I have osteoporosis so now primarily taking for that. anyone have any side effects with this? or any comments about taking this primarily for osteoporosis? Would appreciate any feedback. Thanks.
